channel.title: Basic RSPS coding?
channel.description: Could someone give me a super basic thing or error in a RSPS code that needs to be fixed and you tell me the problem? I am trying to learn how to code but it's not all clicking together in my mind, when I try.

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:15, topic:528237”]i was only joking when i recommended delta as a source to learn from. i’m just really tired of people like vain_ posting with an arrogant attitude. i like you vain, and i enjoy checking up on any project you are working on; however, i don’t think that recommending any type of rsps to learn from will help anyone that has to ask where to start with basic rsps coding, because they should really understand that it starts from the language, and not the source. if this person does not have a good understanding of java, i highly doubt they will look up javadocs or check out the wiki on any emulation they use.

i’m sorry if i seemed a bit ignorant (and that was what i was hoping for), but i really do not like the way many people interact on this forum.[/quote]regardless of whether or not rsps will help learn the language > yes they should try out docs or e-books, or programming basic text games/tools etc.
however, is someone wants to learn java from rsps (i know i did) then it would be best if they worked with well written/documented/efficient code.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

i was only joking when i recommended delta as a source to learn from. i’m just really tired of people like vain_ posting with an arrogant attitude. i like you vain, and i enjoy checking up on any project you are working on; however, i don’t think that recommending any type of rsps to learn from will help anyone that has to ask where to start with basic rsps coding, because they should really understand that it starts from the language, and not the source. if this person does not have a good understanding of java, i highly doubt they will look up javadocs or check out the wiki on any emulation they use.

i’m sorry if i seemed a bit ignorant (and that was what i was hoping for), but i really do not like the way many people interact on this forum.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

yeah come on guys be realistic here. you can learn however you like, but reading code that a bunch of drunk kids hacked out over a weekend isn’t going to be a massive help.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

If you guys think telling a beginner to grab a 20k line source and learn that way is ideal, then you all are fudgeing retarded. Thats like telling a kindergartener to read some 1000-paged novel

Read full topic

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

Vain_:

but you should never tell someone to learn when they will be working with bad code!

Everyone learns differently, in different circumstances, and at a different pace. There is no single right way.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

but you should never tell someone to learn when they will be working with bad code!

Read full topic

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:9, topic:528237”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=646987.msg4350933#msg4350933 date=1376624794]

regardless of whether he knows what oop is or isn’t - it’s best he learn from something written correctly; whether he wants to program in the future, or just basic edits to make some cash. it’s always the best thing to learn something correctly.

it’s like knowing what all of the different organs in your body look like, but having no clue what they are called, which makes complete sense.
[/quote]that is nowhere even close to a comparison.

you need to learn algebra >

would you rather:
learn from someone who does everything wrong, but gets the answer some magical way
learn the material correctly from a knowledgeable tutor[/quote]
i don’t ‘need’ to learn anything, and you should not impose that upon others. i don’t know why you even brought up this:

would you rather: learn from someone who does everything wrong, but gets the answer some magical way learn the material correctly from a knowledgeable tutor
that doesn't even relate to the question the person asked.
many people have, are, and can learn by using rsps - given they aren't fully retarded and use documentation as well.
i didn't say that you can't learn anything from rsps, and you don't have the right to call anyone retarded either. if they are going to use documentation, they should just forget about the rsps and learn about java in a different manner.

Read full topic

learn the material correctly from a knowledgeable tutor

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:5, topic:528237”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=646987.msg4350913#msg4350913 date=1376623188]
@OP, you can do it, i suggest you start with delta, because its a really good source, and has really good performance and is easy to code
[/quote]or start with something programmed with oop in mind, you know- for good practice?

@op i highly suggest you use something runesource, apollo, or hyperion derived (or original releases)

just work read over the code, and read documentation as well.[/quote]
i dont think the op knows or cares what oop is, so i suggest that he uses delta. he will learn so much good techniques from it

Read full topic

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:4, topic:528237”]@OP, you can do it, i suggest you start with delta, because its a really good source, and has really good performance and is easy to code[/quote]or start with something programmed with oop in mind, you know- for good practice?

@op i highly suggest you use something runesource, apollo, or hyperion derived (or original releases)

just work read over the code, and read documentation as well.

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:3, topic:528237”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=646987.msg4350905#msg4350905 date=1376622001]
Unfortunately, a lot of people started programming with rs2 emulation, which isn’t necessarily bad, but it is like trying to repair a car when you have no mechanical background.[/quote]
how do you learn to do anything new? you are taught by someone else, or something else.

most programming e-books give long explanations of the operators/statements/methods/classes/etc.
they also generally show you ‘working code’ so that you can study it, or attempt to replicate it later.

many people have, are, and can learn by using rsps - given they aren’t fully retarded and use documentation as well.

it’s not hard to look at code and understand what it’s doing.[/quote]
yeh i can make gud servers and i dnt evn need to know wat the code is

@OP, you can do it, i suggest you start with delta, because its a really good source, and has really good performance and is easy to code

Read full topic

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

Tutorial:

Unfortunately, a lot of people started programming with rs2 emulation, which isn’t necessarily bad, but it is like trying to repair a car when you have no mechanical background.

how do you learn to do anything new? you are taught by someone else, or something else.

most programming e-books give long explanations of the operators/statements/methods/classes/etc.
they also generally show you ‘working code’ so that you can study it, or attempt to replicate it later.

many people have, are, and can learn by using rsps - given they aren’t fully retarded and use documentation as well.

it’s not hard to look at code and understand what it’s doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic RSPS coding?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

You should probably take a look at some of the Java Tutorials that oracle has:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/index.html

Unfortunately, a lot of people started programming with rs2 emulation, which isn’t necessarily bad, but it is like trying to repair a car when you have no mechanical background.

Read full topic
